"Into the Nightlife" is a song written by Cyndi Lauper, Peer ÃƒÆ’?strÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶m, Johan BobÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¤ck and Max Martin, and produced by Lauper, ÃƒÆ’?strÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¶m and BobÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¤ck, for Lauper&#039;s tenth studio album Bring Ya to the Brink and is set to be released as the album&#039;s second single.

In an interview with Entertainment Weekly, Lauper says that the song title was inspired by Henry Miller&#039;s book Into the Night Life that inspired Lawrence Ferlinghetti&#039;s A Coney Island of the Mind, which inspired her to describe the images of nightlife in New York City.

Lauper first performed the song live at Logo&#039;s NewNowNext Awards on May 20, 2008 (2008-05-20). The ceremony aired on June 7, 2008 (2008-06-07). She also performed "Into the Nightlife" live from Bryant Park Friday as part of the "GMA" Summer Concert series on June 13, 2008.

The music video for the song was partly filmed at Splash Bar in New York City on 20 May 2008. Fans were invited to come and be in the video.

Ari Gold and Colton Ford appear in the video dancing behind Lauper in the night club.
